dependencies.name: dart:core
dependencies.comment:
Built-in types, collections,
and other core functionality for every Dart program.

This library is automatically imported.

Some classes in this library,
such as [String] and [num],
support Dart's built-in data types.
Other classes, such as [List] and [Map], provide data structures
for managing collections of objects.
And still other classes represent commonly used types of data
such as URIs, dates and times, and errors.

## Numbers and booleans

[int] and [double] provide support for Dart's built-in numerical data types:
integers and double-precision floating point numbers, respectively.
An object of type [bool] is either true or false.
Variables of these types can be constructed from literals:

    int meaningOfLife = 42;
    double valueOfPi  = 3.141592;
    bool visible      = true;

## Strings and regular expressions

A [String] is immutable and represents a sequence of characters.

    String shakespeareQuote = "All the world's a stage, ...";

[StringBuffer] provides a way to construct strings efficiently.

    StringBuffer moreShakespeare = new StringBuffer();
    moreShakespeare.write('And all the men and women ');
    moreShakespeare.write('merely players; ...');

The String and StringBuffer classes implement string concatenation,
interpolation, and other string manipulation features.

    String philosophy = 'Live on ';
    String get palindrome => philosophy + philosophy.split('').reversed.join();

[RegExp] implements Dart regular expressions,
which provide a grammar for matching patterns within text.
For example, here's a regular expression that matches
a string of one or more digits:

    var numbers = new RegExp(r'\d+');

Dart regular expressions have the same syntax and semantics as
JavaScript regular expressions. See
<http://ecma-international.org/ecma-262/5.1/#sec-15.10>
for the specification of JavaScript regular expressions.

## Collections

The dart:core library provides basic collections,
such as [List], [Map], and [Set].

A List is an ordered collection of objects, with a length.
Lists are sometimes called arrays.
Use a List when you need to access objects by index.

    List superheroes = [ 'Batman', 'Superman', 'Harry Potter' ];

A Set is an unordered collection of unique objects.
You cannot get an item by index (position).
Adding a duplicate item has no effect.

    Set villians = new Set();
    villians.add('Joker');
    villians.addAll( ['Lex Luther', 'Voldemort'] );

A Map is an unordered collection of key-value pairs.
Maps are sometimes called associative arrays because
maps associate a key to some value for easy retrieval.
Keys are unique.
Use a Map when you need to access objects
by a unique identifier.

    Map sidekicks = { 'Batman': 'Robin',
                      'Superman': 'Lois Lane',
                      'Harry Potter': 'Ron and Hermione' };

In addition to these classes,
dart:core contains [Iterable],
an interface that defines functionality
common in collections of objects.
Examples include the ability
to run a function on each element in the collection,
to apply a test to each element,
to retrieve an object, and to determine length.

Iterable is implemented by List and Set,
and used by Map for its keys and values.

For other kinds of collections, check out the
[dart:collection](#dart-collection) library.

## Date and time

Use [DateTime] to represent a point in time
and [Duration] to represent a span of time.

You can create DateTime objects with constructors
or by parsing a correctly formatted string.

    DateTime now = new DateTime.now();
    DateTime berlinWallFell = new DateTime(1989, 11, 9);
    DateTime moonLanding = DateTime.parse("1969-07-20");

Create a Duration object specifying the individual time units.

    Duration timeRemaining = new Duration(hours:56, minutes:14);

In addition to DateTime and Duration,
dart:core contains the [Stopwatch] class for measuring elapsed time.

## Uri

A [Uri] object represents a uniform resource identifier,
which identifies a resource on the web.

    Uri dartlang = Uri.parse('http://dartlang.org/');

## Errors

The [Error] class represents the occurrence of an error
during runtime.
Subclasses of this class represent specific kinds of errors.

## Other documentation

For more information about how to use the built-in types, refer to
[Built-in Types](http://www.dartlang.org/docs/dart-up-and-running/contents/ch02.html#built-in-types)
in Chapter 2 of
[Dart: Up and Running](http://www.dartlang.org/docs/dart-up-and-running/).

Also, see
[dart:core - Numbers, Collections, Strings, and More](http://www.dartlang.org/docs/dart-up-and-running/contents/ch03.html#ch03-dartcore---strings-collections-and-more)
for more coverage of classes in this package.

The
[Dart Language Specification](http://www.dartlang.org/docs/spec/)
provides technical details.

children.name: Object
children.comment:
The base class for all Dart objects.

Because Object is the root of the Dart class hierarchy,
every other Dart class is a subclass of Object.

When you define a class, you should override [toString]
to return a string describing an instance of that class.
You might also need to define [hashCode] and [==], as described in the
[Implementing map keys]
(http://www.dartlang.org/docs/dart-up-and-running/contents/ch03.html#ch03-implementing-map-keys)
section of the [library tour]
(http://www.dartlang.org/docs/dart-up-and-running/contents/ch03.html).

The equality operator.

The default behavior for all [Object]s is to return true if and
only if [:this:] and [other] are the same object.

Override this method to specify a different equality relation on
a class. The overriding method must still be an equivalence relation.
That is, it must be:

 * Total: It must return a boolean for all arguments. It should never throw
   or return `null`.

 * Reflexive: For all objects `o`, `o == o` must be true.

 * Symmetric: For all objects `o1` and `o2`, `o1 == o2` and `o2 == o1` must
   either both be true, or both be false.

 * Transitive: For all objects `o1`, `o2`, and `o3`, if `o1 == o2` and
   `o2 == o3` are true, then `o1 == o3` must be true.

The method should also be consistent over time, so equality of two objects
should not change over time, or at least only change if one of the objects
was modified.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override
the [hashCode] method as well to maintain consistency.

children.name: toString
children.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.

children.name: noSuchMethod
children.comment:
[noSuchMethod] is invoked when users invoke a non-existent method
on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the
invocation are passed to [noSuchMethod] in an [Invocation].
If [noSuchMethod] returns a value, that value becomes the result of
the original invocation.

The default behavior of [noSuchMethod] is to throw a
[NoSuchMethodError].

children.name: hashCode
children.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the
same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality
operator [:==:]. Other than that there are no guarantees about
the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and
there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides [hashCode] it should override the
equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

children.name: runtimeType
children.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

Creates a new [Object] instance.

[Object] instances have no meaningful state, and are only useful
through their identity. An [Object] instance is equal to itself
only.

children.name: Comparable
children.comment: Interface used by types that have an intrinsic ordering.

children.name: compareTo
children.comment:
Compares this object to another [Comparable]

Returns a value like a [Comparator] when comparing [:this:] to [other].

May throw an [ArgumentError] if [other] is of a type that
is not comparable to [:this:].

children.name: compare
children.comment:
Compare one comparable to another.

This utility function is used as the default comparator
for the [List] sort function.

children.name: edit
children.comment: Embed an Ace [Editor] instance into the DOM, at the given [element].

children.name: createEditSession
children.comment: Creates a new [EditSession] with the given [text] and language [mode].

children.name: VirtualRenderer
children.comment: The renderer draws to the screen.

children.name: updateFull
children.comment:
Updates all of the layers, for all the rows.

By default this schedules an asynchronous update.  If [force] is `true`
then the update is performed immediately.

children.name: firstVisibleRow
children.comment: The index of the first visible row.

children.name: fixedWidthGutter
children.comment: Whether or not the gutter has a fixed width.

Creates a new VirtualRenderer within the given [container], applying the 
given [theme].

children.name: UndoManager
children.comment: Manages the undo stack for an [EditSession].

children.name: redo
children.comment:
Performs a redo operation on the associated document, reapplying the last 
change.

If [select] is _false_ then the range of the change will not be selected.  

Returns the range of the operation that is performed, or `null` if 
[hasRedo] is _false_.

children.name: reset
children.comment: Destroys the stack of [undo] and [redo] operations.

children.name: undo
children.comment:
Performs an undo operation on the associated document, reverting the last 
change.

If [select] is _false_ then the range of the change will not be selected.  

Returns the range of the operation that is performed, or `null` if 
[hasUndo] is _false_.

children.name: hasRedo
children.comment: Returns `true` if there are [redo] operations left to perform.

children.name: hasUndo
children.comment: Returns `true` if there are [undo] operations left to perform.

children.name: isLoaded
children.comment: Whether or not this theme has finished loading.

children.name: name
children.comment:
The name of this theme.

The [name] should be one of the values in [THEMES].

children.name: path
children.comment:
The path of this theme.

This is a path such as `ace/theme/monokai`.

children.name: onLoad
children.comment: Completes when this theme [isLoaded].

children.name: THEMES
children.comment:
A list of the available themes for use with the [new Theme.named] 
constructor.

This list contains all of the themes in the ace package.  An application
using this package may choose to include a subset or a superset of these
themes.

children.name: named
children.comment:
Creates a theme for the given [name].

The [name] should be one of the values in [THEMES].

Creates a theme for the given [path].

The [path] is a path such as `ace/theme/monokai`.

children.name: Selection
children.comment:
Encapsulates the current [cursor] position and the current text selection 
[range] of an [EditSession].

The positions (row and column) used in a selection are in [Document] 
coordinates representing the coordinates as they appear in the document 
before applying soft wrap and folding.

children.name: moveCursorBy
children.comment:
Moves the [cursor] position by the given number of [rows] and [columns]
relative to its current position.

Negative values for [rows] or [columns] move the [cursor] backwards in the
document.

children.name: moveCursorDown
children.comment: Moves the [cursor] down one row.

children.name: moveCursorFileEnd
children.comment: Moves the [cursor] to the end of the document.

children.name: moveCursorFileStart
children.comment: Moves the [cursor] to the start of the document.

children.name: moveCursorLeft
children.comment: Moves the [cursor] left one column.

children.name: moveCursorLineEnd
children.comment: Moves the [cursor] to the end of the current line.

children.name: moveCursorLineStart
children.comment: Moves the [cursor] to the start of the current line.

children.name: moveCursorRight
children.comment: Moves the [cursor] right one column.

children.name: moveCursorTo
children.comment:
Moves the [cursor] to the given [row] and [column].

If [keepDesiredColumn] is `true`, the cursor move does not respect the
previous column.

children.name: moveCursorToScreen
children.comment:
Moves the [cursor] to the the given [row] and [column] in screen 
coordinates.

If [keepDesiredColumn] is `true`, the cursor move does not respect the
previous column.

The given screen [row] and [column] are converted to document coordinates
with [EditSession.screenToDocumentPosition] before the [cursor] is moved.

children.name: moveCursorUp
children.comment: Moves the [cursor] up one row.

children.name: moveCursorWordLeft
children.comment: Moves the [cursor] to the start of the first word on the left.

children.name: moveCursorWordRight
children.comment: Moves the [cursor] to the start of the first word on the right.

children.name: selectAll
children.comment: Selects all the text in the document.

children.name: selectAWord
children.comment: Selects a word, including its right whitespace.

children.name: selectDown
children.comment: Selects down one row.

children.name: selectFileEnd
children.comment: Selects to the end of the document.

children.name: selectFileStart
children.comment: Selects to the start of the document.

children.name: selectLeft
children.comment: Selects to the left one column.

children.name: selectLine
children.comment: Selects the entire current line.

children.name: selectLineEnd
children.comment: Selects to the end of the current line.

children.name: selectLineStart
children.comment: Selects to the start of the current line.

children.name: selectRight
children.comment: Selects to the right one column.

children.name: selectTo
children.comment: Selects to the given [row] and [column].

children.name: selectUp
children.comment: Selects up one row.

children.name: selectWord
children.comment: Selects an entire word boundary.

children.name: selectWordLeft
children.comment:
Selects the first word to the left and moves the [cursor] to the start of 
the word.

children.name: selectWordRight
children.comment:
Selects the first word to the right and moves the [cursor] to the end of
the word.

children.name: cursor
children.comment: The current position of the cursor.

children.name: isEmpty
children.comment: Returns `true` if this selection is empty.

children.name: isMultiLine
children.comment: Returns `true` if this selection is multi-line.

children.name: onChangeCursor
children.comment: Fired whenever the [cursor] position changes.

children.name: onChangeSelection
children.comment: Fired whenever the cursor selection changes.

children.name: range
children.comment: The current [Range] of the selected text.
Creates a new [Selection] for the given [session].

children.name: Search
children.comment: Handles text searches within a [Document].

children.name: find
children.comment:
Searches for [options.needle] in the given [session]. 

If the [options.needle] is found, this method returns the [Range] where 
the text first occurs.  Otherwise, it returns `null`.

If [options.backwards] is `true`, the search goes backwards in the 
[session].

children.name: findAll
children.comment:
Searches for all occurrences  of [options.needle] in the given [session]. 

This method returns a [Range] iterable of all the text occurrences that
match the [options].  If the [options.needle] is not found, the iterable
will be empty.

If [options.backwards] is `true`, the search goes backwards in the 
[session].

children.name: options
children.comment: The current [SearchOptions].
Creates a new Search with default [SearchOptions].

children.name: needle
children.comment: The string or regular expression you are looking for.

children.name: backwards
children.comment:
Whether to search backwards from where the cursor currently is; defaults 
to `false`.

children.name: caseSensitive
children.comment: Whether the search is case-sensitive; defaults to `false`.

children.name: range
children.comment: The [Range] to search within. Set this to `null` for the whole document.

children.name: regExp
children.comment: Whether the search is a regular expression or not; defaults to `false`.

children.name: skipCurrent
children.comment:
Whether or not to include the current line in the search; defaults to 
`false`.

children.name: start
children.comment: The starting [Range] to begin the search.

children.name: wholeWord
children.comment: Whether the search matches only on whole words; defaults to `false`.

children.name: wrap
children.comment:
Whether to wrap the search back to the beginning when it hits the end; 
defaults to `false`.

children.name: Range
children.comment:
A region within an [Editor].

A [Range] can be thought of as a rectangle from a [start] point to an [end]
point.

children.name: compare
children.comment:
Compares the given [row] and [column] with this range.

This algorithm will return the following values:

    -1  if the point comes before this range
    0   if the point comes within this range
    1   if the point comes after this range

children.name: compareTo
children.comment:
Compares the given [other] with this range.

This method forwards the call to the [compareRange] method.

children.name: contains
children.comment:
Returns `true` if the given [row] and [column] are within this range.

This method performs a check that is _endpoint - inclusive_.  That is, it
will return `true` if:

    start.row     <= row      <= end.row      &&
    start.column  <= column   <= end.column

children.name: containsRange
children.comment:
Returns `true` if the given [other] is within this range.

This method performs a check that is _endpoint - inclusive_.

children.name: intersects
children.comment: Returns `true` if the given `other` intersects this range.

children.name: isEnd
children.comment:
Returns `true` if the point given by [row] and [column] is equal to this
range's [end] point.

children.name: isStart
children.comment:
Returns `true` if the point given by [row] and [column] is equal to this
range's [start] point.

children.name: isEmpty
children.comment: Returns _true_ if this range's [start] point equals its [end] point.

children.name: isMultiLine
children.comment: Returns _true_ if this range spans across multiple lines.

children.name: start
children.comment: The start point of this range.

children.name: end
children.comment: The end point of this range.

children.name: copy
children.comment: Constructs a new [Range] that is a copy of the given [other].

children.name: union
children.comment:
Creates a new range that is the union of all the given [ranges].

The returned range has a [start] point that comes first among all the
given [ranges] and an [end] point that comes last among all the given 
[ranges].

If the given [ranges] is an empty iterable this throws an [ArgumentError].
Constructs a new [Point] with the given [row] and [column].

children.name: copy
children.comment: Constructs a new [Point] that is a copy of the given [other].

children.name: isLoaded
children.comment: Whether or not this mode has finished loading.

children.name: onLoad
children.comment: Completes when this mode [isLoaded].

children.name: forFile
children.comment: Creates a mode for the given [filePath], based on its file extension.

Creates a mode for the given [modePath].

The [modePath] is a path such as `ace/mode/text`.

children.name: EditSession
children.comment:
Encapsulates the state of an [Editor].

An instance of [EditSession] stores all of the data about an [Editor]'s 
state, thus providing a means to change editor state dynamically.

An instance of [EditSession] may be attached to only one [Document].  An
instance of [Document] may be attached to more than one [EditSession].

children.name: addGutterDecoration
children.comment: Adds the given CSS [className] to the given [row].

children.name: clearBreakpoint
children.comment:
Removes a breakpoint on the given [row] and fires an 
[onChangeBreakPoint] event.

children.name: clearBreakpoints
children.comment:
Removes all [breakpoints] on all rows and fires an [onChangeBreakPoint] 
event.

children.name: documentToScreenColumn
children.comment:
Returns the screen column for the given [row] and [column] of the current
[document].

children.name: documentToScreenRow
children.comment:
Returns the screen row for the given [row] and [column] of the current
[document].

children.name: duplicateLines
children.comment: Duplicates all of the text from [firstRow] to [lastRow], inclusive.

children.name: getAWordRange
children.comment:
Gets the [Range] of a word, including its right whitespace.

Start from the given [row] and [column].

children.name: getLine
children.comment:
Returns a verbatim copy of the given line [row] as it is in the current 
[document].

children.name: getRowLength
children.comment: Returns the number of screen rows in a wrapped line for the given [row].

children.name: getTextRange
children.comment: Returns all of the text within the given [range] of the [document].

children.name: getWordRange
children.comment:
Returns the [Range] of the first word boundary it finds starting at the
given [row] and [column].

children.name: indentRows
children.comment:
Indents all of the rows from [startRow] to [endRow], inclusive, by 
prefixing each row with the given [indentString].

children.name: insert
children.comment:
Inserts a block of [text] at the given [position] and returns a point at
the end of the inserted text.  This method also fires an [onChange] event.

children.name: isTabStop
children.comment:
Returns _true_ if the character at the given [position] is a tab stop.

The logic to determine a tab stop is equivalent to:
    [useSoftTabs] && ([position.column] % [tabSize] == 0)

children.name: moveLinesDown
children.comment:
Shifts all of the lines in the [document] from [firstRow] to [lastRow],
inclusive, down one row.

children.name: moveLinesUp
children.comment:
Shifts all of the lines in the [document] from [firstRow] to [lastRow],
inclusive, up one row.

children.name: remove
children.comment: Removes the given [range] from the current [document].

children.name: removeGutterDecoration
children.comment: Removes the given CSS [className] from the given [row].

children.name: replace
children.comment:
Replaces a given [range] in the [document] with the new [text] and returns
a point at the end of the new text.

children.name: screenToDocumentPosition
children.comment:
Converts screen coordinates to [document] coordinates. 

This takes into account code folding, word wrap, [tabSize], and any other 
visual modifications.

children.name: setBreakpoint
children.comment:
Sets a breakpoint on the given [row] using the optional CSS [className]
and fires an [onChangeBreakPoint] event.

children.name: setBreakpoints
children.comment:
Sets a breakpoint on all of the given [rows] and fires an 
[onChangeBreakpoint] event.

children.name: setWrapLimitRange
children.comment:
Sets the boundaries of line wrap. 

Either value can be `null` to have an unconstrained wrap, or, they can be 
the same number to pin the [wrapLimit].  The [min] wrap value specifies
the left side wrap and the [max] wrap value specifies the right side wrap.
If a new value for [min] or [max] is set then this method fires an 
[onChangeWrapMode] event.

children.name: toggleOverwrite
children.comment: Sets the value of [overwrite] to the opposite of its current value.

children.name: onChange
children.comment: Fired whenever the [document] changes.

children.name: onChangeBreakpoint
children.comment:
Fired whenever the gutter changes, either by setting or removing
breakpoints, or when the gutter decorations change.

children.name: onChangeOverwrite
children.comment: Fired whenever the [overwrite] changes.

children.name: onChangeScrollLeft
children.comment: Fired whenever the [scrollLeft] changes.

children.name: onChangeScrollTop
children.comment: Fired whenever the [scrollTop] changes.

children.name: onChangeTabSize
children.comment: Fired whenever the [tabSize] changes.

children.name: onChangeWrapLimit
children.comment: Fired whenever the [wrapLimit] changes.

children.name: onChangeWrapMode
children.comment: Fired whenever the [useWrapMode] changes.

children.name: breakpoints
children.comment:
A map from row index to CSS class name for all of the breakpoints in the 
current [document].

A value of _null_ for any given row index indicates that no breakpoint is
set for that row.

children.name: length
children.comment: Returns the current [document.length].

children.name: screenLength
children.comment: Returns the length of the screen.

children.name: screenWidth
children.comment: Returns the width of the screen.

children.name: tabString
wrapLimit
children.comment: The current wrap limit.

children.name: wrapLimitRange
document
children.comment: The current [Document] associated with this session.

children.name: mode
children.comment: The current [Mode] of this session.

children.name: newLineMode
children.comment: The new line mode.  May be one of `windows`, `unix` or `auto`.

children.name: overwrite
children.comment:
Whether or not overwrite is enabled in this session.

A _true_ value means overwrite is enabled.  Any text that is entered will
write over any text after it.  Setting this to a new value fires an
[onChangeOverwrite] event.

children.name: scrollLeft
children.comment:
The value of the distance between the left of the editor and the leftmost 
part of the visible content.  Setting this to a new value fires an
[onChangeScrollLeft] event.

children.name: scrollTop
children.comment:
The value of the distance between the top of the editor and the topmost 
part of the visible content.  Setting this to a new value fires an
[onChangeScrollTop] event.

children.name: tabSize
children.comment:
The number of spaces that define a soft tab.

For example, a tab size of `4` combined with [useSoftTabs] will transform
the soft tabs to be equivalent to four spaces.  Setting this to a new
value fires an [onChangeTabSize] event.

children.name: undoManager
children.comment: The current [UndoManager].

children.name: undoSelect
children.comment: Whether or not the range of an undo or redo operation is selected.

children.name: useSoftTabs
children.comment:
Whether or not to use soft tabs.  

A _true_ value means soft tabs are being used.  Using soft tabs means to
use spaces instead of the tab character `\t`.

children.name: useWorker
children.comment:
Whether or not this session uses a worker.

A _true_ value means to use a worker.

children.name: useWrapMode
children.comment:
Whether or not line wrapping is enabled. 

A _true_ value means to line wrap.  The default value is _false_ for no
line wrapping.  Setting a new value fires an [onChangeWrapMode] event.

children.name: value
children.comment: The current [document.value].

Creates a new EditSession and associates it with the given [document] and 
text [mode].

children.name: oldSession
children.comment: The old [EditSession].

children.name: newSession
children.comment: The new [EditSession].

children.name: Editor
children.comment:
The main entry point into the Ace functionality.

An [Editor] manages an [EditSession] (which in turn manages a [Document]), 
as well as the [VirtualRenderer], which draws everything to the screen.
Event sessions dealing with the mouse and keyboard are bubbled up from the
[Document] to the [Editor], which decides what to do with them.

children.name: blockIndent
children.comment: Indents the current line by the current [session.tabSize].

children.name: blockOutdent
children.comment: Outdents the current line by the current [session.tabSize].

children.name: blur
children.comment: Blurs the current [textInput].

children.name: clearSelection
children.comment: Clears the current [selection].

children.name: copyLinesDown
children.comment:
Copies all of the lines in the current [selection] down one row.

This method copies entire rows, so the copied range may be larger than
the current [selectionRange].

children.name: copyLinesUp
children.comment:
Copies all of the lines in the current [selection] up one row.

This method copies entire rows, so the copied range may be larger than
the current [selectionRange].

children.name: focus
children.comment: Brings the current [textInput] into focus.

children.name: gotoPageDown
children.comment: Scrolls the document down a page and updates the [cursorPosition].

children.name: gotoPageUp
children.comment: Scrolls the document up a page and updates the [cursorPosition].

children.name: insert
children.comment: Insert [text] at the current [cursorPosition].

children.name: navigateDown
children.comment:
Move the cursor down in the document the specified number of [times].

Note that this does de-select the current [selection].

children.name: navigateFileEnd
children.comment:
Move the cursor to the end of the current document.

Note that this does de-select the current [selection].

children.name: navigateFileStart
children.comment:
Move the cursor to the start of the current document.

Note that this does de-select the current [selection].

children.name: navigateLeft
children.comment:
Move the cursor left in the document the specified number of [times].

Note that this does de-select the current [selection].

children.name: navigateLineEnd
children.comment:
Move the [cursorPosition] to the end of the current line.

Note that this does de-select the current [selection].

children.name: navigateLineStart
children.comment:
Move the [cursorPosition] to the start of the current line.

Note that this does de-select the current [selection].

children.name: navigateRight
children.comment:
Move the [cursorPosition] right in the document the specified number of 
[times].  

Note that this does de-select the current [selection].

children.name: navigateTo
children.comment:
Move the [cursorPosition] to the specified [row] and [column].

Note that this does de-select the current selection.

children.name: navigateUp
children.comment:
Move the [cursorPosition] up in the document the specified number of 
[times].

Note that this does de-select the current [selection].

children.name: navigateWordLeft
children.comment:
Move the [cursorPosition] to the word immediately to its left. 

Note that this does de-select the current [selection].

children.name: navigateWordRight
children.comment:
Move the [cursorPosition] to the word immediately to its right. 

Note that this does de-select the current [selection].

children.name: redo
children.comment:
Performs a redo operation on the current [EditSession.document], 
reapplying the last change.

The current [session]'s [UndoManager.hasRedo] may be called to check if
there are any redo operations to perform.

children.name: removeToLineEnd
children.comment:
Remove all of the words to the right of the current [selection], until the 
end of the line.

children.name: removeToLineStart
children.comment:
Removes all of the words to the left of the current [selection], until the 
start of the line.

children.name: removeWordLeft
children.comment: Remove the word directly to the left of the current [selection].

children.name: removeWordRight
children.comment: Remove the word directly to the right of the current [selection].

children.name: scrollPageDown
children.comment:
Scrolls the document down a page but does _not_ change the 
[cursorPosition].

children.name: scrollPageUp
children.comment: Scrolls the document up a page but does _not_ change the [cursorPosition].

children.name: selectAll
children.comment: Selects all the text in this editor.

children.name: setValue
children.comment:
Sets the current [EditSession.value] to the given [value].

The given [cursorPosition] will determine which of the following calls is
made on this editor after setting the new [EditSession.value]:

* 0   : [selectAll]
* 1   : [navigateFileEnd]
* -1  : [navigateFileStart]

children.name: toggleOverwrite
children.comment: Sets the value of [overwrite] to the opposite of its current value.

children.name: toLowerCase
children.comment: Converts the current [selection] entirely into lowercase characters.

children.name: toUpperCase
children.comment: Converts the current [selection] entirely into uppercase characters.

children.name: undo
children.comment:
Performs an undo operation on the current [EditSession.document], 
reverting the last change. 

The current [session]'s [UndoManager.hasUndo] may be called to check if
there are any undo operations to perform.

children.name: onBlur
children.comment: Fired whenever this editor has been blurred.

children.name: onChange
children.comment: Fired whenever the [session.document] changes.

children.name: onChangeSession
children.comment: Fired whenever the [session] changes.

children.name: onCopy
children.comment: Fired whenever text is copied.

children.name: onFocus
children.comment: Fired whenever this editor comes into focus.

children.name: onPaste
children.comment: Fired whenever text is pasted.

children.name: copyText
children.comment: The string of text in the current [selectionRange].

children.name: cursorPosition
children.comment: The current position of the cursor.

children.name: firstVisibleRow
children.comment: The index of the first visible row.

children.name: isFocused
children.comment: Returns _true_ if current [textInput] is in focus.

children.name: selection
children.comment: The current [Selection].

children.name: selectionRange
children.comment: The [Selection.range] of the current [selection].

children.name: value
children.comment: Returns the current [session.value].

children.name: dragDelay
children.comment: The current mouse drag delay, in milliseconds.

children.name: fontSize
children.comment: The font size in pixels for this editor's text.

children.name: highlightActiveLine
children.comment: Whether or not the current line should be highlighted.

children.name: highlightGutterLine
children.comment: Whether or not the current line gutter should be highlighted.

children.name: highlightSelectedWord
children.comment: Whether or not the current selected word should be highlighted.

children.name: overwrite
children.comment: The current [session.overwrite].

children.name: printMarginColumn
children.comment: The column number of where the print margin is.

children.name: readOnly
children.comment:
Whether or not this editor is set to read-only mode.

If `true` then this editor can not be modified.

children.name: scrollSpeed
children.comment: The current mouse scroll speed, in milliseconds.

children.name: session
children.comment:
The current [EditSession] being used; setting a new session fires an 
[onChangeSession] event.

children.name: showInvisibles
children.comment:
Whether or not invisible characters such as the space character and new 
line character are shown in this editor.

children.name: showPrintMargin
children.comment: Whether or not the [printMarginColumn] is shown in this editor.

children.name: theme
children.comment: The current [Theme] for this editor.

children.name: Document
children.comment:
Encapsulates the text of a document. 

At its core, a [Document] is just an array of strings where the index of the
array points to a row in the document.

An instance of [Document] may be attached to more than one [EditSession].

children.name: applyDeltas
children.comment: Applies all of the given [deltas] to this document in the order given.

children.name: createAnchor
children.comment: Creates a new [Anchor] to define a floating point in this document.

children.name: getAllLines
children.comment: Returns a copy of all the lines in this document.

children.name: getLines
children.comment: Returns a copy of the lines between [firstRow] and [lastRow], inclusive.

children.name: getLine
children.comment: Returns a verbatim copy of the given line [row] as it is in this document.

children.name: getTextRange
children.comment:
Returns all of the text within the given [range] of this document as a 
single string.

children.name: indexToPosition
children.comment:
Converts the given character [index] in this document to a [Point].

Index refers to the "absolute position" of a character in this document.
For example:
    var x = 0; // 10 characters, plus one for newline
    var y = -1;
Here, `y` has an index of `15`; `10` characters for the first row, a
newline character, and `5` characters until `y` in the second row. 

The optional [startRow] defaults to `0` and represents the row from which 
to start the conversion.

children.name: insert
children.comment:
Inserts a block of [text] at the given [position] and returns a point at
the end of the inserted text.  This method also fires an [onChange] event.

children.name: insertInLine
children.comment:
Inserts [text] into the [position] at the current row and returns a point
at the end of the inserted text.  This method also fires an [onChange]
event.

children.name: insertLines
children.comment:
Inserts the given [lines] into the document, starting at the given [row]
and returns a point at the end of the inserted lines.  This method also 
fires an [onChange] event.

children.name: insertNewLine
children.comment:
Inserts a [newLineCharacter] into this document at the current row's 
position and returns a point at the end of the insertion.  This method 
also fires an [onChange] event.

children.name: isNewLine
children.comment:
Returns `true` if [text] is a newline character.  That is, one of `\r\n`, 
`\r` or `\n`.

children.name: positionToIndex
children.comment:
Converts the given [position] in this document to the character's index.

Index refers to the "absolute position" of a character in this document.
For example:
    var x = 0; // 10 characters, plus one for newline
    var y = -1;
Here, `y` has an index of `15`; `10` characters for the first row, a
newline character, and `5` characters until `y` in the second row. 

The optional [startRow] defaults to `0` and represents the row from which 
to start the conversion.

children.name: remove
children.comment: Removes the given [range] from this document.

children.name: removeInLine
children.comment:
Removes the range specified by [row/startColumn] -> [row/endColumn] and 
returns the removed [range.start] point.  

This method also fires an [onChange] event.

children.name: removeLines
children.comment:
Removes the range of lines from the given [startRow] -> [endRow], 
inclusive, and returns the removed lines.  

This method also fires an [onChange] event.

children.name: removeNewLine
children.comment:
Removes the [newLineCharacter] between the given [row] and the row 
immediately following it.  This method also fires an [onChange] event.

children.name: replace
children.comment:
Replaces a given [range] in this document with the new [text] and returns
a point at the end of the new text.

children.name: revertDeltas
children.comment:
Reverts all of the given [deltas] to this document in reverse of the 
order given.

children.name: onChange
children.comment: Fired whenever this document changes.

children.name: length
children.comment: The number of rows in this document.

children.name: newLineCharacter
children.comment: The current newline character, based on the current [newLineMode].

children.name: newLineMode
children.comment: The new line mode.  May be one of `windows`, `unix` or `auto`.

children.name: value
children.comment:
All the lines in this document as a single string, split by the 
[newLineCharacter].

Creates a new Document with the given [text], if any, or else it is empty.

**WARNING** do not set [useExperimental] to `true` in production code; 
this is an experimental flag to enable continuous integration testing of a 
work-in-progress pure Dart implementation, and may be removed at any time.

children.name: text
children.comment: The text removed from the document by this change.

children.name: lines
children.comment: The lines removed from the document by this change.

children.name: nl
children.comment:
The value of the document's newline character during this change as 
defined by [Document.newLineCharacter].

children.name: text
children.comment: The text inserted in the document by this change.

children.name: lines
children.comment: The lines inserted in the document by this change.

children.name: Delta
children.comment: A change in a [Document].

children.name: action
children.comment: The action that triggered this change.

children.name: range
children.comment: The [Range] of this change within the document.

children.name: AnchorChangeEvent
children.comment: Fired by an [Anchor] whenever its position changes.

children.name: oldPosition
children.comment: The old position of the anchor.

children.name: newPosition
children.comment: The new position of the anchor.

children.name: Anchor
children.comment:
A floating [Point] in a [Document].

Whenever text is inserted or deleted before the [document]'s cursor, the 
[position] of the anchor is updated.

children.name: setPosition
children.comment:
Sets the anchor [position] to the specified [row] and [column]. 

By default, the position will be clipped to the bounds of the [document].
If [clip] is given as `false`, the position will not be clipped.

children.name: onChange
children.comment: Fired whenever the [position] changes.

children.name: document
children.comment: The document of this anchor.

children.name: position
children.comment: The current position of this anchor.

Creates a new Anchor and associates it with the given [document] at the
given [row] and [column] starting position.

**WARNING** do not set [useExperimental] to `true` in production code; 
this is an experimental flag to enable continuous integration testing of a 
work-in-progress pure Dart implementation, and may be removed at any time.

children.name: dispose
children.comment:
Dispose of any resources held by this object.

This method will release any javascript proxy objects help by this 
object.  It will also close any streams exposed by the object.  It is an
error to call any methods or access any fields of this object after this
method has been called.
